{"step_by_step_thinking": "BRCA mutation analysis is a genetic test that is used to identify harmful changes (mutations) in either one of the two breast cancer susceptibility genes — BRCA1 and BRCA2. This test is not specific to any population or ethnicity, and can be performed on anyone who is suspected to have a high risk of developing breast or ovarian cancer. Therefore, it is possible to perform a BRCA mutation analysis in the Greek population.", "answer_choice": "A"}
